Ingredients.8: 1 (15.5 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained

Ingredients.9: 1 (15.25 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained

Ingredients.12: 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

Ingredients.13: 3 cups shredded pepper Jack cheese, divided

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.

Directions.2: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, jalapenos, bell pepper, and garlic; cook and stir until onion is translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low and add salsa, black beans, corn, chili powder, and cumin. Bring to a simmer; let simmer for 5 minutes.

Directions.3: Combine 2 cups pepper Jack cheese, ricotta cheese, spinach, egg, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

Directions.4: Place 6 corn tortillas in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Add 1/2 of the vegetable mixture using a slotted spoon, followed by 1/2 of the cheese and spinach mixture. Add a layer of 6 tortillas and follow with remaining vegetables and remaining cheese mixture. Top with remaining tortillas. Spread enchilada sauce across the top and remaining pepper Jack cheese.

Directions.5: Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted and bubbly, 45 minutes to 1 hour.
